website_summaries.verdict: Even if you aren't a professional chef, you will appreciate the quality of this duo – they are sturdy and practical for most uses, and built to last.
pros: A professional-quality set that's ideal for serious cooks
Works like a charm for grilling
We love the long stainless steal blades (4.5 in.)
cons: Not for use on non-stick surfaces
The metal feels somewhat bendable, but some cooks appreciate the flexibility
They are also large, and take up a lot of space in a utensil holder or drawer

customer_reviews.title: Working as a short-order cook during my college days, ...
customer_reviews.text: Working as a short-order cook during my college days, I've flipped my share of burgers on the griddle. These grill spatulas get the job done, and for the price, you can't beat em.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfpacker

customer_reviews.title: Flip and Turn Like a Pro!
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever wanted to feel like one of those Japanese steakhouse chefs, flipping meats and veggies and making jokes about, "Butterflies" as you flip the coagulated milk product over the heads of your customers? Then look no further! These are sturdy, solid turners with flexible metal paddles and solid wooden handles on them that, when you have one in each hand, make you feel like a real pro. Using these on my new outdoor griddle, I have no issues with flipping, turning, and fiddling my food to perfection. Now....if only they came with holsters for my hips.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Pralle

customer_reviews.title: worthless
customer_reviews.text: They are too long to be of any use in a normal pan. The rounded ends mean you can't turn a pancake, or a tortilla without ripping the thing to shreds. Can't use if you want anything other than scrambled eggs. They seem durable but of course they will be since I can't use them!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Reader

customer_reviews.title: Good value if you want it
customer_reviews.text: Handel rivets not tight. Metal thick and unfinished, maybe suitable for barbecue grill, not a kitchen frypan. Free return if I travel 45 minutes to a UPS store, $6 to print a UPS label for local drop-off. Angry at Amazon; I'll use the free drop-off at Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these as replacements for our home kitchen, with low to medium expectation of durability and quality. My husband, a professional cook/chef for 40+ years and pretty scathing about "mail order", was very impressed and pronounced them restaurant quality utensils. They are pretty heavy duty and definitely not for coated or non-stick cookware.....great for my cast iron and stainless.
customer_reviews.author: Dee M

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price...
customer_reviews.text: but I found that the edges were very jagged and sharp from the pressing process that created them, and this jagged edge scrapped the seasoning from my outside griddle. No biggie, some oil and high griddle temps got the coating back, but a bit more care and quality control in the factory would have saved me the trouble. I have used them two or three times now, and after a couple of trips through the dish washer, the wooden handles are starting to get a bit loose, but I'm sure that they are supposed to be hand washed and not meant to undergo the dishwashing cycle, so I'll say that's my fault and won't blame the cheap spatulas.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Decent set for my Blackstone Griddle
customer_reviews.text: Decent set for the money, I would definitely buy again. They could be built a little better, especially the handle, but this shouldn’t keep you from buying it. They do their job and they look nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grilling necessity, durable.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as gift and they loved it. Handle fits well in large hands and weight of each item is solid for easy chopping and flipping on flattop.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Campers

customer_reviews.title: these spatulas are quite LARGE!
customer_reviews.text: They are a bit larger than I need for daily cooking but will come in handy for larger projects. They are decent quality, unlike some of the plastic or silicone spatulas.
customer_reviews.author: SamEE

customer_reviews.title: Good quality tools but....
customer_reviews.text: Rivets holding the handles on were not set. Handles came apart. I found the rivets and set them properly, and now they work fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Darnell Isaacs

customer_reviews.title: Dynamic Duo
customer_reviews.text: You can certainly buy more expensive spatulas but why? This is for a barbecue, I'm not trying to impress anyone I'm just trying to flip a burger without singing all the hair off my arm and these do the job. This is a great deal on a pair of spatulas, and if you're a burger masher you'll like the perforated one. But if your spatula needs to say Cuisinart, Le Creuset or Victorinox on it to make you a better burger flipper than God bless you, Amazon sells those too..
customer_reviews.author: G. W. Meador

customer_reviews.title: Larger and heavier than what you may expect
customer_reviews.text: These are much larger than I thought them to be. Heavier too. Seems or good quality but I bought them to simply use in the kitchen, thinking they were smaller so will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: This sure is a bargain, I doubt I will use the one with holes in it, except as a spare if the plain one gets lost or damaged. The flat part of the spatula is almost too long, and the edges are a bit sharp, but the tool is eminently useful, to turn six rashers of bacon at once or easily flip an egg or pancake, I mostly use on an electric griddle, but would be handy on a BBQ grill also. I will hand wash as I would not expect the wood handles to stand up to repeated exposure to a dishwasher, quality is quite good, very well put together.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Carter

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not the durability I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: After being exposed to repeated cleaning and sanitizer over a couple months they developed spots of rust. They're good turners but I was expecting they'd be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Route66Guy

customer_reviews.title: Handle fell off
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace one's at work. Handle rivets have to be replaced already. We don't use both everyday. Otherwise happy with purchase for price.
customer_reviews.author: J Hammett

customer_reviews.title: ... times over the past few months and they work great. They seem to be made really well and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used the several times over the past few months and they work great. They seem to be made really well and the stainless steel is sturdy. I'm able to place a ball of ground beef on my griddle and flatten it out with no problem or worries of it bending or breaking.
customer_reviews.author: erikm

customer_reviews.title: Flipping Out
customer_reviews.text: These are very good quality. I use them to do cheesesteaks on a big flat top. I do food vending at festivals and such, so they get a workout for sure. They work great. I've had them for almost a year and they are still in very good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie House

customer_reviews.title: Must have tools for the avid griddler
customer_reviews.text: My husband got a big outdoor flat top griddle and bought these to use with it. He loves them and uses them often. I've even used them myself to flip french toast. It has a nice feel in the hand and they are well-made. I definitely recommend this set. I would say, as with all wooden handled products, be sure to wash these by hand and not put them in the dishwasher, in order to prolong the life of the wood.
customer_reviews.author: SVD

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: Been wanting a pair of these for a while finally just ordered them. Handle seems flimsy? Maybe a bit loose is the best way to discribe. Gonna try and find a way to tighten them up.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Worst quality spatulas ever.
customer_reviews.text: Just got these today, what a horrible product. Handles are not tight, all wobbly and shaky, and are the cheapest grade material imaginable. You can’t even let them touch anything because they easily dent. Have not used; and won’t. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the rounded tips
customer_reviews.text: I little flimsy, and feels a bit cheap when trying to move food. I don't like the rounded tips, especially when I'm trying to move food around like fried rice.
customer_reviews.author: ReadingPapa

customer_reviews.title: I’ll be buying better ones soon.
customer_reviews.text: Says stainless but apparently not. Already had issues with rusting spots.
customer_reviews.author: Zon is great

customer_reviews.title: it would have been a nice set. great for moving around stuff on a ...
customer_reviews.text: the one with the holes in it the handle which is wood, was loose n the steel bounces around, other than that, it would have been a nice set. great for moving around stuff on a hot grill
customer_reviews.author: MattDC

customer_reviews.title: not very well built
customer_reviews.text: rivets holding the handle on were already fallen out upon delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Mj

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Started to rusted after only a few months of being stored in my outdoor kitchen drawer, which is in a covered and screened patio.
customer_reviews.author: CFP

customer_reviews.title: I got these for my husband to use on grill ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband to use on grill. He loves how long they are. It keeps hands further from the heat and plenty of surface area to pick up to hamburger patties.
customer_reviews.author: sherry Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great spatulas . We bought a set for my father in law to use for grilling this summer. Great weight and length.
customer_reviews.author: katherine donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Needed help...
customer_reviews.text: The material is rather thick, and I had to chamfer the end so the tool could slide under the foods it was being used to move/flip; after the modification the tool works sufficiently well.
customer_reviews.author: William K. Frank

customer_reviews.title: I like them. My wife says they are too big
customer_reviews.text: I like them. My wife says they are too big. What does she know? Hmmm. Oh well I’ll order her a smaller one.
customer_reviews.author: Master

customer_reviews.title: Big bad wonderful turners
customer_reviews.text: These turners are very heavy duty, with very solid handles. I use them for our BBQ, and they're so stiff I can use them to scrape the grille before I start cooking. And, they don't flop around when I'm turning a big pork rib or chicken breast. These things have made my BBQ duties much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Costero

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: These really do the job, and they look great in the kitchen. They are fantastic omelette spatulas.
customer_reviews.author: Ottawa0214

customer_reviews.title: Product Sucks
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased for a restaurant. I was VERY disappointed as it was extremely flimsy. I wanted to return them But they can't be returned. They would be ok for a personal kitchen or a little kids play kitchen. But they do not hold up in a commercial kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Decent spatulas. Wood handles loosen up after several uses, but are more than still usable. Don't leave them submersed in water for extended periods of time and you won't have a problem. Clean them up when you're finished, coat them with oil, and you won't have a problem with them rusting.
customer_reviews.author: NETX Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: These arrived with what appeared to be discoloration spots on the steel surfaces. Additionally the handle rivets were loose and allowed the whole handle to wobble. After one hand washing the wooden handles are falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: R. Seifried

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe all you read
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the money. I was worried about the two spatulas were going to be too flimsy and light weight. Not so. The stainless steel is great quality and so are the wood handles - well riveted and of nice quality. The stainless blades are heavy and nicely finished. Buy 'em for the summer grill, you'll like them!
customer_reviews.author: Leterbuck

customer_reviews.title: Flipping burgers and pancakes like a pro
customer_reviews.text: If you own a griddle you need these. Be warned though, if you leave them on a hot surface, the metal running through the sides of the wooden handle will get hot.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Brink

customer_reviews.title: Great, useful tools for  my new grill!
customer_reviews.text: Got these to go with my new lodge grill/griddle. Used them this morning to make bacon and eggs on the new grill. There isn't a whole lot to say about flippers - but these worked great, are long enough to scoot under all the bacon and easy enough to handle to serve the eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie Berg

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: These are total junk. They can hold no weight and if you bend them slightly the rivets Pop out! this is worse than stuff from the dollar store
customer_reviews.author: Zhe German

customer_reviews.title: Take care of them and they'll take care of you
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Flipping two at a time! Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Super cool
customer_reviews.text: It seems like they are going to last forever, I use them almost every day and they are working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Dez

customer_reviews.title: Wood handles not riveted on well
customer_reviews.text: As many other reviewers commented, the handles are not riveted on well / tight. There is a slight gap between the wood / steel turner / wood sandwich. As a result, the steel wobbles a little. Plus food and liquids can get into that gap and it would be very had to clean out. Item was returned.
customer_reviews.author: A. Yee

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: They work but are cheaply built. The rivets on one of my spatulas are loose with no way to tighten them.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony E.

customer_reviews.title: These work fine, glad to have stainless turners
customer_reviews.text: These work fine, glad to have stainless turners. The wood has turned quickly, appears that it has not been treated. Hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: SashaThumpa14

customer_reviews.title: 1 down 1 to go
customer_reviews.text: Caught a splinter from it before my coworkers stole the one with holes in it
customer_reviews.author: Dizzie

customer_reviews.title: Good product, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect, good wood handles and perfect size for my cast iron skillets and BBQ grill. I also purchase a 7.5 inch spatula, and I definitely use the 7.5" more often. Metal thickness was perfect, not too stiff, but sturdy. Cleans nicely, but I don't put them into the dishwasher, only hand-wash.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hale

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Very wobbly on the rivet of one of the spatulas I give it a few uses before it breaks 😤
customer_reviews.author: Natalie meester

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I had this less than 1 week, using it for breakfast and dinner and one of the rivets came out and the second rivet is starting to come out. Would be nice but just not well put together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Handle is affixed by 3 poorly installed rivets. It falls apart in a matter of weeks. Avoid!!!
customer_reviews.author: Darren C.

customer_reviews.title: Good, very good
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I bbq a lot and I use these a lot. No complains but I also don't know what else to write about them. They are two good quality spatulas that make my bbq easier.
customer_reviews.author: Shahzad

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not super strong, but a good size and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jefferykent2

customer_reviews.title: Short term for the price
customer_reviews.text: A month old and already a little rickety. Not sure how long they will last but I like using them.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!! ordered this on a sat and got it in on Monday. the spatula is stainless steel and does not feel cheap at all. especially for the price... My boyfriend loved them...
customer_reviews.author: Yvette E. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Handle Material
customer_reviews.text: Can not be placed in dishwasher. The first and only time the item was placed in the dishwasher, all the finish was removed from the wood handles and the handles began to split.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: They work pretty well but the handles are loose and the spatula ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for use with our new Blackstone Griddle. They work pretty well but the handles are loose and the spatula part seems to flop around too much.
customer_reviews.author: CoCo

customer_reviews.title: Works great on a griddle or BBQ Grill
customer_reviews.text: Makes turning pancakes, salmon, tuna and any other delicate food that need flipping a lot simpler. Works great on a griddle or BBQ grill. It may work with a skillet if you have a very large one (12" or bigger), but it won't work so well with a smaller skillet.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: He's very pleased with the heavier metal blade
customer_reviews.text: My son has been wanting longer spatulas to make his specialty Philly cheese steak sandwiches. He's very pleased with the heavier metal blade, which picks up onions, steak & mushrooms perfectly to put into a bun. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Eve B Mayes

customer_reviews.title: Poor assembly.
customer_reviews.text: The rivers on one spatula were not right, thus making the handle loose and wobbly.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Sadler

customer_reviews.title: Great for smashburgers
customer_reviews.text: Product performed as expected. Don't know about durability as I have used only once
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are AWESOME for cooking on the grill
customer_reviews.text: These are AWESOME for cooking on the grill. Solid and sturdy...I picked up a whole meat loaf with the one with holes and it did not phase it one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: good turners, but the metal is a little thick
customer_reviews.text: good turners, but the metal is a little thick, making them a little stiffer than they should be, a little more flexible would make a better turner.
customer_reviews.author: Doug P.

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Product at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Doesn't work as well in smaller pans on a stove, but very high quality product!
customer_reviews.author: csmith

customer_reviews.title: Both handles arrived wiggly and loose in their handles
customer_reviews.text: Cheap construction - both 'blades' arrived wiggly and loose in their handles. Large gaps between the metal and wood. Will last a couple of years. Not worth the bother of returning.
customer_reviews.author: elvisaintdead

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsy but for the price they work, ...
customer_reviews.text: A little flimsy but for the price they work, at some point I will purchase restaurant quality but for now these do the job.
customer_reviews.author: ron coleman

customer_reviews.title: Solid, large, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent spatulas. Very solid. Handles need a little finish sanding and oiling, but that's my own personal nit-picking.
customer_reviews.author: Lars SveenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: What you see is what you get.
customer_reviews.text: And that's not a bad thing. They look good and so they are. I just need a bigger flat top grill.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Philly cheesesteak flipper
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a great product. I've only had it a couple days, but worked great on my philly cheesesteak.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great with our grill. Hope to enjoy them alot
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Bates

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: the product was ok but are very poorly made, fell apart by the 3rd use
customer_reviews.author: Edgar_benitez

customer_reviews.title: ... these for one of my employees and they work great I like the way that handles are screwed
customer_reviews.text: I brought these for one of my employees and they work great I like the way that handles are screwed on
customer_reviews.author: Lori Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Its OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good metal quality, my only issue is the wood handles are a bit lose and seem with time they will come off. Needs to be more sturdy. But for the price you cant really complain! Cheap and works
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice as the $20 a piece kind sold at the box stores
customer_reviews.author: Clyde

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Loose handles, the thin metal is too flexable, and they aren't anything like professional models.
customer_reviews.author: norflorjagfan

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good but handles have very poor material of wood. It is not well sanded and gave me splinters.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Mort

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend if you are looking for real stainless steal as ...
customer_reviews.text: Not real stainless steal. after some years of used it started showing the inner and getting oxidized. I do not recommend if you are looking for real stainless steal as the description says..
customer_reviews.author: claudia sierra

customer_reviews.title: Very, very cheap quality. The handles aren't attached ...
customer_reviews.text: Very, very cheap quality. The handles aren't attached well. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Macy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful cookware! Very durable and perfect for any cooking need.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Kay Fox

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: These were cheaply made. The handle was loose on both. It did do the intended job but I don't see these lasting more than a month before the handles completely fall off.
customer_reviews.author: George K.

customer_reviews.title: They aren't so bad that I feel like I need to replace them ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use at work. The metal is flimsy and the handles are poorly attached. They aren't so bad that I feel like I need to replace them immediately but they are most certainly not professional quality, which was one of my search criteria. Fine for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Glaser

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: too thin and too flexible. so do not use these as much.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. O'malley

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy, nice handle. Perfect for stove top cooking and our out door skillet!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy design, very comfortable in your hands to cook with.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The handle was loose out of the box and fell apart on less than 2 weeks. Wouldn't recommend or buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Again different ways to use it. I use it on the grill, grilling make easy.
customer_reviews.author: WinnieB

customer_reviews.title: They work as expected. Price was the biggest determining ...
customer_reviews.text: They work as expected. Price was the biggest determining factor. Inexpensive, but just what I needed at a price I was willing to pay.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works fine. wod doesnt like a dishwasher though. The woods get rough fast.

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had a hole on the handle to hang ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish it had a hole on the handle to hang or a string of some sort to hang on my grill

customer_reviews.title: Good set for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Good set for the price. One of the handles was a little loose. Not riveted very well but works fine.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you own a restaurant or use a grill.
customer_reviews.text: The durability is what im looking for, they're just too long for me.

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsy couldn't flip my 1/4 burger without it ...
customer_reviews.text: A little flimsy couldn't flip my 1/4 burger without it bending.

customer_reviews.title: Burger time!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stuff, exactly as described. These remind me of what I used back when we didn't complain about making burgers for minimum wage.

customer_reviews.title: Pitting after 2 uses!
customer_reviews.text: I have used them 2 times and the stainless is starting to pit

customer_reviews.text: these are hefty good and a little big for home use unless you have a griddle and a gaggle of chillins.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great spatulas at a great price. Very sturdy and my husband loves them for his grill. Will definitely buy again if needed!

customer_reviews.text: Just the right size for the BBQ - work great.

customer_reviews.title: Forever Spatulas
customer_reviews.text: Real deal commercial grade spatulas. Quality metal, quality handles. I expect I'll have these until the day I drop dead.

customer_reviews.title: Great set for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great set for the price. Yes they are a little flimsy, but nothing that impacts performance. At this point you couldn't ask for more.

customer_reviews.title: A good product. Sense of use are really good
customer_reviews.text: A good product. Sense of use are really good. ... Recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for....
customer_reviews.text: They're ok. The handles are loose because the rivet isn't tight enough.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hibachi masters!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for about a year and use them for hibachi at home. They work great and have held up well. I would definitely purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H.

customer_reviews.title: Great item.
customer_reviews.text: I gave my son this for Christmas for when he BBQ's this summer. He really likes the item. Got a set for myself also. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia McAfee

product_meta.title: overstockedkitchen New Grill, Turner, Stainless Steel, Riveted Smooth Wood Handle, Commercial Grade, One Perforated & Solid Face Spatula, Set of 2
product_meta.description: These commercial grade turners feature a stainless steel blade, brass rivets and smooth easy to grip wood handles. Price reflects a set of two. Length - 14 1/2 inches length (handle) - 4 1/2 inches length (blade) - 10 inches width (blade) - 3 inches.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars940 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
